pageContext.claim: “Last quarter, as you know, our GDP grew 4.1 percent and I think it’s going to go a lot higher than that. ... $52 billion trade deficit reduction.”
pageContext.analysis: The $52 billion figure is based on a misinterpretation of the Commerce Department data; in reality the drop in the trade deficit between the first and secon quarters is about $20 billion. For the first half of the year, the trade deficit increased and is on track to be the biggest since 2008. Many experts think that the data was affected by the fact that companies overseas rushed to buy U.S. goods before Trump’s tariffs took effect.
